column1: NEW YORK ( AP ) -- At his age
column2: Orlando Hernandez takes his starts 	 inning by inning . Add them up
column3: and they have produced some strong 	 outings for the New York Mets . 	 Hernandez won his fourth straight decision Thursday
column4: allowing 	 four hits in seven innings in a 7 - 3 win over San Diego that 	 stretched New York 's NL East lead to a season - high 14 games . 	 " I do n't look at seven innings
column5: " El Duque said . " I look at it 	 one inning at a time
column6: three outs . I get through that inning
column7: I look 	 at the next inning . " 	 Hernandez ( 8 - 8) came to the Mets from Arizona on May 24 to 	 bolster the back end of the rotation . He has won four straight 	 decisions and in seven of his last nine starts
column8: he has pitched at 	 least seven innings . He has not lost in his last six starts since 	 June 30 . 	 The attitude of the 40 - year - old Hernandez sits well with manager 	 Willie Randolph . 	 " When he gets in a rhythm
column12: " the manager said . " It 's command on 	 the mound
column13: working his spots . He 's really starting to feel his 	 rhythm on all his pitches . His fastball is up . His velocity is 	 really good . " 	 With their fifth straight win
column14: the Mets completed a three - game 	 sweep and dropped the Padres into a first - place tie in the NL West 	 with idle Arizona and Los Angeles
column15: which played Colorado later 	 Thursday night . 	 Randolph rested several regulars in the day game and surrounded 	 Hernandez with a lineup of bench players
column16: including three -- 	 outfielders Ricky Ledee and Michael Tucker and catcher Mike 	 DiFelice -- who were n't on the roster a week ago . He kept the left 	 side of his infield intact
column18: and Jose Reyes and David Wright 	 made the difference . 	 Reyes tripled home two runs in the second inning and then 	 touched off a four - run rally in the seventh that broke a 3 - 3 tie . 	 Wright had a pair of doubles including the hit that scored Reyes 	 with the go - ahead run . 	 " You have to be confident every at - bat
column19: " Wright said . " You 	 ca n't be scared . You have to want to be there . You ca n't shy away 	 from it . " 	 Reyes opened the seventh with a single
column20: and Endy Chavez beat out 	 a bunt for his second hit . Wright followed with a double to left 	 against Doug Brocail ( 2 - 1 ) for a 4 - 3 lead . An intentional walk to 	 Carlos Delgado loaded the bases
column21: Jose Valentin singled for two more 	 runs and Tucker followed with an RBI double 	 San Diego took the lead in the first inning on Adrian Gonzalez 's 	 20th homer . 	 Todd Walker walked with one out and moved to second on what 	 might have been a double - play ball . Valentin let Brian Giles ' soft 	 liner to second drop in front of him but then threw to first base
column22: allowing Walker to reach second . Gonzalez followed with homer on a 	 2 - 0 pitch . 	 " He just made a mistake
column23: " Gonzalez said . " He did n't make many 	 in the whole game . He keeps the ball down . He moves it around . He 	 keeps you off balance . " 	 New York went ahead 3 - 2 in the second when Reyes drove in two 	 runs with his 14th triple of the season and scored on a sacrifice 	 fly by Chavez . 	 After Gonzalez 's homer
column24: Hernandez allowed just one more hit 	 until the seventh
column25: retiring 15 of 16 hitters over one stretch . 	 Brian Giles ended that string with a leadoff double in the seventh 	 and scored on Josh Bard 's double . 	 Padres starter Chris Young
column26: 5 - 0 with a 2.42 earned - run average in 10 road 	 starts this season coming in
column28: four hits and six 	 walks in five innings . 	 Game notes 	 Gonzalez has reached base in 30 consecutive games
column29: the longest 	 streak by a Padre since Ryan Klesko reached in 56 straight in 2002 . 	 ... Klesko ( shoulder surgery ) is continuing a rehab assignment at 	 Single - A Lake Elsinore . He has not played for San Diego this 	 season . ... Chavez stole second and third in the first inning . 	 Wright also had two steals . ... Reyes ' 14 triples and 48 stolen 	 bases lead the majors and his 94 runs scored are second only to 	 Philadelphia 's Chase Utley
column32: threw out Dave Roberts trying to stretch a single in the third 	 inning . It was the Mets ' 30th outfield assist
column33: which leads the 	 majors . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column34: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million
column35: sources confirmed to ESPN . 	 From who we think deserves MVP and Cy Young to if the voters got it right

column37: arguably the best player in the major leagues
column39: particularly when his team is n't winning .

column1: CINCINNATI ( AP ) -- Bronson Arroyo got braids in his hair
column2: hoping 	 to end a long slump and a big series in style . 	 The new hairdo did n't do a thing . 	 Scott Spiezio hit the last of the Cardinals ' three homers off 	 Arroyo on Thursday
column3: and St. Louis gained a soothing series split 	 with a 6 - 1 victory over the Cincinnati Reds that left the NL 	 Central rivals right where they started . 	 The Cardinals held their ground while in town
column4: leaving 3½ games 	 ahead of second - place Cincinnati . 	 " It 's not the end of the world
column6: it was a snapshot of how things have gone for two teams 	 that seem to be racing in reverse . Both have losing records over 	 the last two weeks
column7: unable to take advantage of the other 's 	 struggles . 	 After blowing a ninth - inning lead on Wednesday night
column8: the 	 Cardinals were encouraged to leave with a four - game split . 	 " To come back after we got beat like that last night
column10: " manager Tony La Russa said . 	 Jim Edmonds and Chris Duncan also homered off Arroyo ( 9 - 8)
column11: so 	 frustrated by a seven - week slump that he got his shoulder - length 	 hair braided into cornrows two days earlier to try to change his 	 luck . 	 Instead
column12: the All - Star pitcher matched his career high for homers 	 allowed and remained winless since June 19 . He 's 0 - 5 in his last 10 	 starts with a 5.29 earned - run average
column13: a stretch of futility that includes three 	 blown saves by his bullpen . 	 So
column14: do the cornrows go ? 	 " I think I 'll keep them for a while
column15: " Arroyo said . " I 'm about 	 at the end of my rope
column16: superstition - wise . Maybe I 'll have to bring 	 in a live chicken or something . " 	 Duncan added another solo homer in the ninth off Rheal Cormier
column17: his first two - homer game of the season . 	 Rookie Anthony Reyes ( 4 - 5 )
column18: who has helped the Cardinals ' 	 rotation get through a series of injuries
column19: struggled with his own 	 medical problem -- an upset stomach -- through five shutout innings . 	 He gave up a pair of hits
column20: walked two and hit three batters . 	 Reyes has made 11 starts this season
column21: filling in for injured 	 Chris Carpenter
column22: Sidney Ponson and Mark Mulder at various times . 	 Most of his starts have been brief -- only three have lasted six 	 innings . 	 There was a reason for this one . 	 " The last couple of innings
column24: " 	 Reyes said . 	 A day after closer Jason Isringhausen gave up a game - ending
column25: two - run homer to David Ross in the Reds ' 8 - 7 comeback win
column26: the 	 bullpen held on . Adam Wainwright allowed Javier Valentin 's 	 pinch - hit solo homer in the seventh
column27: but that was it . 	 " They switched the momentum on us last night
column28: but it 's our job 	 to keep our composure and do what we 're capable of doing
column29: " Spiezio 	 said . 	 The Reds did all they could to promote the mid - August showdown
column30: giving away Davey Concepcion bobbleheads for one game and offering 	 half - price tickets and $ 1 hot dogs for the other three . They sold 	 more than 130
column31: 000 hot dogs and packed their ballpark for the last 	 three games . 	 Neither team has won very often lately
column32: keeping the NL Central 	 tight . The Cardinals have lost 10 of their last 14 games while 	 holding onto first place . The Reds have lost 8 of 12
column33: but no ground 	 in the standings over that span . 	 The main difference is that the Reds have won their head - to - head 	 games
column34: going 8 - 4 against the Cardinals overall to stay in the race . 	 They finish the series with three games next week in St. Louis . 	 " When you 're playing the division leader
column35: you 'd love to have 	 gotten three out of four
column36: but we 'll take it and move on
column37: " manager 	 Jerry Narron said . " I think it will go down to the end of the 	 year
column39: Duncan and Spiezio played big roles in the series 	 split . Edmonds hit a grand slam in Wednesday night 's loss
column40: and had 	 a solo homer and an RBI single off Arroyo as part of a three - hit 	 day . 	 Duncan led off the fifth with a homer -- he was 7 - for-14 with 	 three homers in the series . And Spiezio
column41: filling in at third base 	 for the injured Scott Rolen
column42: put the Cardinals up 5 - 0 with his 	 two - run shot later in the fifth . Spiezio has hit safely in his last 	 six games
column43: going 7 - for-18 with three homers . 	 Game notes 	 Edmonds ' homer was his 228th in seven seasons with the 	 Cardinals
column44: tying Ray Lankford for fourth on the club 's list . 	 Edmonds hit 121 with the Angels . ... Rolen left Wednesday night 's 	 game with back spasms . He 's day - to - day . ... RF So Taguchi lost 	 track of the number of outs in the fourth inning
column45: starting for the 	 dugout after catching Juan Castro 's fly ball for only the second 	 out . ... The Reds optioned OF Chris Denorfia to Triple - A Louisville 	 to open a roster spot for OF Todd Hollandsworth
column46: acquired from 	 Cleveland a day earlier . ... Valentin has three of the Reds ' eight 	 pinch - hit homers . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column47: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more
column48: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season
column49: leading all rookies with a 4.1 WAR . 	 Take a look back at the best plays from NL Rookie of the Year Jonathan India 's 2021 campaign . 	 Julio Lugo

column1: MILWAUKEE ( AP ) -- Doug Davis is disappointed he did n't adjust his 	 delivery any earlier . 	 Davis won his third straight decision Thursday
column2: leading the 	 Milwaukee Brewers over Chicago 8 - 6 and handing the Cubs consecutive 	 losses for the first time in nearly three weeks . 	 " This game is a game of adjustments
column3: " he said . " Wish I could 	 have made the adjustment about 20 starts ago . " 	 Brewers pitching coach Mike Maddux suggested a mechanical change 	 that caused Davis to alter how he rotates his upper body and close 	 off his shoulder . 	 " I was hitting my spots and had better control
column4: " he said after 	 striking out eight in seven innings
column6: eight hits 	 and three walks . 	 It also helped that Davis ( 8 - 6 ) was given a seven - run lead . and 	 he improved to 3 - 0 in his last four starts despite a 6.09 ERA . He 	 got out of trouble in the third when he struck out Phil Nevin and 	 Jacque Jones with the bases loaded . 	 " It all revolves around your starting pitching
column7: " Brewers 	 manager Ned Yost said after his team took two of three from the 	 Cubs . 	 Francisco Cordero completed the six - hitter
column8: working the ninth 	 for his fifth save in as many chances since Milwaukee acquired him 	 from Texas on July 28 . 	 Chicago pinch - hitter Cesar Izturis walked in the ninth and 	 Aramis Ramirez reached on center fielder Brady Clark 's second error 	 of the game . Cordero retired Nevin
column9: then got Jones to hit into a 	 game - ending double play . 	 " He 's got a real mound presence
column10: " Yost said . " You could see 	 the warrior come out with runners at first and second . " 	 Mark Prior ( 1 - 6 ) gave up six runs -- five earned -- and four hits 	 in three innings
column11: and all four batters he walked scored . 	 " From the outset
column12: he did n't have his control . His velocity was 	 pretty good . It 's just a matter of control
column13: " Cubs manager Dusty 	 Baker said . 	 Prior is 1 - 2 with a 6.75 earned - run average since July 21
column14: when he came off the 	 disabled list after recovering from a strained left oblique muscle . 	 He has walked 28 and hit eight in 43 2/3 innings this season and 	 has not pitched past the sixth . 	 " It 's obviously been a long year
column15: " Prior said . " Things 	 have n't been as great as I would have wanted them to be . " 	 Ramirez drove in three runs for the Cubs with a sacrifice fly in 	 the first and his 27th homer . a two - run drive in the fifth . He has 	 11 homers in 26 games since the All - Star break . 	 Chicago had not lost consecutive games since being swept by 	 Washington in a three - game series July 21 - 23 . 	 Milwaukee loaded the bases in the first on two walks around Jeff Cirillo 's bloop single . Prior knocked down Kevin Mench with an 	 inside pitch
column16: and Mench followed with a two - run single off the wall 	 in left . 	 Rookie Angel Pagan
column18: made a 	 throwing error that allowed the runners to advance
column19: Gabe Gross hit 	 a sacrifice fly
column20: Tony Graffanino was hit by a pitch and David Bell 	 added another sacrifice fly . 	 Bell and Rivera hit RBI singles in the third following two more 	 walks by Prior
column21: and Graffanino had a two - run single in the fourth 	 off Juan Mateo that made it 8 - 1 . Mateo had been scheduled to start 	 Saturday at Colorado . 	 Nevin had an RBI single in the seventh
column22: and Henry Blanco hit a 	 two - run homer in the eighth against Jose Capellan . 	 " We came back
column23: " Baker said . " We just did n't come all the way 	 back . " 	 Chicago 's Will Ohman hit Prince Fielder in the back with a pitch 	 in the sixth
column24: and Fielder glared at Ohman before going to first . 	 Davis knocked down Nevin in the seventh . 	 During Wednesday 's 6 - 3 victory over the Cubs
column25: Milwaukee 's Dave Bush hit Michael Barrett and Ramirez . Yost said he did n't think 	 there was any retaliation going on . 	 " Nah
column26: you could see Prior was struggling and we took advantage 	 of it
column27: " Yost said . 	 Game notes 	 Clark 's error in the seventh snapped the Brewers ' string of 	 11 consecutive errorless games
column28: which tied the franchise record set 	 in 1979 . ... Chicago 's Ryan Theriot went 3 - for-3 . ... Davis is 6 - 5 	 in 12 games against the Cubs . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column29: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: CLEVELAND ( AP ) -- Ryan Garko had acted out his first big league 	 homer many times as a youngster . Actually hitting it was an even 	 bigger thrill . 	 Garko had his first homer and drove in four runs to help Cliff 	 Lee win for the first time in nearly a month
column2: leading the Cleveland 	 Indians over the Los Angeles Angels 14 - 2 Thursday night . 	 " It 's a special feeling
column3: one I dreamed about since I was a 	 kid
column5: whose 431 - foot drive over the center - field wall 	 gave Cleveland a 13 - 2 lead in the sixth inning . " I did n't know how 	 to react . It sank in when I got high - fives in the dugout . That 's 	 when I realized
column6: ' I did it . ' " 	 Garko also hit a three - run double that capped Cleveland 's 	 seven - run fourth to help the Indians win consecutive games for the 	 first time since July 3 - 4 .
